content:
Hi, I’m Akash! I’m a 5th-year Dual Degree (B.Tech + M.Tech) student in Electrical Engineering at Indian Institute of Technology Madras.
I’m passionate about exploring new areas that can solve important real-world problems. I primarily work in the field of Machine Learning and its applications in Natural Language Processing. I’m advised by Prof. Mitesh Khapra at IIT Madras. I have published a few papers in top NLP conferences and journals such as TACL, ACL, EMNLP. I’ve also had the opportunity to build large-scale Machine Learning models during my internships with Microsoft and startups like HyperVerge, and Lynk.
summary:

title: M Akash Kumar

summary: We propose a multi-reference adversarial dialogue evaluation dataset and an evaluation metric which is pretrained on a massive corpus of 727 Million Reddit conversations.
title: Improving Dialog Evaluation with a Multi-reference Adversarial Dataset and Large Scale Pretraining

content: Click the Cite button above to demo the feature to enable visitors to import publication metadata into their reference management software.    Click the Slides button above to demo Academic’s Markdown slides feature.   Supplementary notes can be added here, including code and math .
summary: We propose a modified LSTM cell with a diversity-driven training objective to improve the transparency and explainability of attention models
title: Towards Transparent and Explainable Attention Models

content: Click the Cite button above to demo the feature to enable visitors to import publication metadata into their reference management software.    Click the Slides button above to demo Academic’s Markdown slides feature.   Supplementary notes can be added here, including code and math .
summary: We propose Refine Networks, a framework which mimics the human process of generating any piece of text by first creating an initial draft and then refining it.
title: Let’s Ask Again: Refine Network for Automatic Question Generation
